net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.texture

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.opengl.texture.Texture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpriteSheet

    public class Texture
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to create an Object-oriented type Texture that can be wrapped onto OpenGL polygons.
    Since:
    Apr 26, 2013 at 10:49:13 PM, v0.2
    Version:
    Apr 26, 2013 at 10:49:13 PM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

      Create a Texture from the given BufferedImage.
      Texture(java.lang.String location)
      Create a Texture from the File at the specified location.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture

        public Texture(java.lang.String location)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Create a Texture from the File at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the Image File containing the Texture.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is an error reading from the Image File at the specified location.

      • Texture

        public Texture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Create a Texture from the given BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        image - The BufferedImage instance to use to create the Texture.

      • Texture

        public Texture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
       boolean recreate)
        Create a Texture from the given BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        image - The BufferedImage instance to use to create the Texture.
        recreate - Whether or not to recreate the BufferedImage with the needed type of TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Get the ID number that OpenGL assigned the Texture.
        Returns:
        The ID number of the Texture.

      • getPixel

        public int getPixel(int x,
           int y)
        Get the integer representation of the pixel at the specified location of (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        Returns:
        The integer representation of a pixel. eg.: Red with alpha = 0xFFFF0000.

      • getPixels

        public int[] getPixels(int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height)
        Get the integer representation of the pixels within the rectangle (x, y, width, height) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        width - The width of the rectangular selection of pixels to get.
        height - The height of the rectangular selection of pixels to get.
        Returns:
        The integer representation of the pixels. eg.: An array with values that include integers such as: Red with alpha = 0xFFFF0000.

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel(int x,
            int y,
            int value)
        Set the integer representation of the pixel at the specified location of (x, y) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        value - The integer representation of a pixel. eg.: Red with alpha = 0xFFFF0000.

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels(int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height,
             int[] values)
        Set the integer representation of the pixels within the rectangle (x, y, width, height) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        width - The width of the rectangular selection of pixels to set.
        height - The height of the rectangular selection of pixels to set.
        values - The integer representation of the pixels. eg.: An array with values that include integers such as: Red with alpha = 0xFFFF0000.
        The array size must equal (width * height).

      • getPixelBytes

        public byte[] getPixelBytes(int x,
                   int y)
        Get the byte representation of the pixel at the specified location of (x, y) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        Returns:
        The byte representation of a pixel. eg.: Red with alpha = byte[] { -1, 0, 0, -1 } (-1 == 255 considering Two's Complement).

      • getPixelsBytes

        public byte[] getPixelsBytes(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Get the byte representation of the pixels within the rectangle (x, y, width, height) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        width - The width of the rectangular selection of pixels to get.
        height - The height of the rectangular selection of pixels to get.
        Returns:
        The byte representation of the pixels. eg.: An array with values that include bytes such as: Red with alpha = byte[] { -1, 0, 0, -1 } (-1 == 255 considering Two's Complement)

      • setPixelBytes

        public void setPixelBytes(int x,
                 int y,
                 byte[] values)
        Set the byte representation of the pixel at the specified location of (x, y) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        value - The byte representation of a pixel. eg.: Red with alpha = byte[] { -1, 0, 0, -1 } (-1 == 255 considering Two's Complement).

      • setPixelsBytes

        public void setPixelsBytes(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  byte[] values)
        Set the byte representation of the pixels within the rectangle (x, y, width, height) on the image.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal location of the pixel (Left = 0).
        y - The vertical location of the pixel (Bottom = 0).
        width - The width of the rectangular selection of pixels to set.
        height - The height of the rectangular selection of pixels to set.
        values - The byte representation of the pixels. eg.: An array with values that include bytes such as: Red with alpha = byte[] { -1, 0, 0, -1 } (-1 == 255 considering Two's Complement)
        The array size must equal (width * height * 4).

      • getImageOffsets

        public float[] getImageOffsets()
        Get the offsets needed for OpenGL to wrap the Texture to a polygon.
        Returns:
        A float array containing the values for the offsets of the Texture.

      • isBound

        public boolean isBound()
        Get whether or not the Texture is currently bound and ready to be used.
        Returns:
        Whether the Texture is bound or not.

      • bind

        public void bind()
        Bind the Texture as the current Texture to be used.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the width of the Texture's source image file.
        Returns:
        The width (in pixels) of the Texture.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the height of the Texture's source image file.
        Returns:
        The height (in pixels) of the Texture.

        public static void unbind()
        Unbind the OpenGL Texture instance.
